issue.title: Upgrade from 2.8.4 to 2.9.0 get failed to migrate the database, error: Dirty database version 120. Fix and force version
issue.body:
I have been running upgrades, and I am trying to get from 2.3.3 to 2.9.0
- I have had some issues with this before, which is why I have been stuck with such an old version. but now I have made a duplicate copy of my live server, so that I can try and troubleshoot this... so far I have done this:
2.3.3 -> 2.4.0 ok
2.4.0 -> 2.5.0 ok
2.5.0 -> 2.6.0 ok
2.6.0->2.7.0 ok
2.7.0->2.8.0 ok
2.8.0 ->2.8.4 ok
2.8.4 -> 2.9.0 nok ok.
-
2023-10-19T11:34:31Z [DEBUG] [/pkg/config/db/manager.go:36]: create DB config manager with cache enabled
2023-10-19T11:34:31Z [INFO] [/core/main.go:163]: initializing configurations...
2023-10-19T11:34:31Z [INFO] [/lib/config/systemconfig.go:173]: key path: /etc/core/key
2023-10-19T11:34:31Z [INFO] [/lib/config/config.go:92]: init secret store
2023-10-19T11:34:31Z [INFO] [/core/main.go:165]: configurations initialization completed
2023-10-19T11:34:31Z [INFO] [/common/dao/base.go:67]: Registering database: type-PostgreSQL host-postgresql port-5432 database-registry sslmode-"disable"
2023-10-19T11:34:31Z [INFO] [/common/dao/base.go:72]: Register database completed
2023-10-19T11:34:31Z [DEBUG] [/migration/migration.go:37]: current database schema version: 120
2023-10-19T11:34:31Z [INFO] [/common/dao/pgsql.go:135]: Upgrading schema for pgsql ...
2023-10-19T11:34:31Z [ERROR] [/common/dao/pgsql.go:140]: Failed to upgrade schema, error: "Dirty database version 120. Fix and force version."
2023-10-19T11:34:31Z [INFO] [/vendor/github.com/golang-migrate/migrate/v4/migrate.go:199]: Closing source and database
2023-10-19T11:34:31Z [INFO] [/vendor/github.com/golang-migrate/migrate/v4/migrate.go:199]: Closing source and database
2023-10-19T11:34:31Z [FATAL] [/core/main.go:194]: failed to migrate the database, error: Dirty database version 120. Fix and force version.
-
Above is the tail of the log in the core container

I am aware of this issue:  https://github.com/goharbor/harbor/issues/19320
and I have tried to follow the hints there, but no help.

I have tried many things, and many times. I have in the past tried to upgrade in bigger chunks, but since that has failed, that is why I have taken such baby-steps above. 

if there are any files that you need to see to better troubleshoot, of if I can do anything to test something let me know.

comment.body:
1. https://github.com/goharbor/harbor/blob/main/make/migrations/postgresql/0120_2.9.0_schema.up.sql
2. the prepare script will convert the old harbor.yml to the new one(which may contains the new configuration introduced in the new version).

issue.title: Harbor periodic replication sometimes fail with no reason and sometime takes super long time in progress
issue.body:
I have set up some periodic replication rules in harbor, but I'm noticing that some replication were successful, but some were failed and in progress for a very long time, like couple hours or even forever. When checking the logs of replication, there's no error at all, just regular replication logs, copying artifacts. Also, there's some error about harbor hooks in harbor-jobservice logs, not sure if that has anything to do with this.  Is there any idea about why this is going on?
![MicrosoftTeams-image (2)](https://github.com/goharbor/harbor/assets/93493482/7db86722-874f-42c8-840a-5eebfa33c687)
![MicrosoftTeams-image (1)](https://github.com/goharbor/harbor/assets/93493482/000c6bea-0b86-4036-8430-420c74bb8b14)

comment.body: This seems strange, because normally a failure would be an error and error log would be printed. How did you install harbor?

issue.title: Trigger tag retention API should be non-blocking

labels.name: area/tag-retention
labels.description: Issues relating to the tag retention policies features

issue.body:
How can we help you?

Currently the trigger tag retention API is blocked which will occur timeout if the project has huge repositories(tasks), should refactor this API to be asynchronously like replication and scanAll.

issue.title: Replication failure: "code":"MANIFEST_BLOB_UNKNOWN","message":"blob unknown to registry"
issue.body:
**Expected behavior and actual behavior:**
Pull replication of one repository shall not fail due to (prior) replication of another repository

**Steps to reproduce the problem:**
1. Configure a registry as "Docker Registry" as provider and https://index.docker.io as the "Endpoint URL"
2. Create a project "rancher"
3. Create a replication rule "repo_a", "Pull-based" with resource filter: Name=rancher/rancher-agent, Tag=matching: v2.5.12-debug1-windows-1809
4. Run the replication rule "repo_a" (select it and click "REPLICATE")
5. Create a replication rule "repo_b", "Pull-based" with resource filter: rancher/mirrored-longhornio-csi-node-driver-registrar, Tag=matching: v2.5.0
6. Run the replication rule "repo_b" (select it and click "REPLICATE")

The replication of repo_b will fail and the following entry can be observed in the log:
`2023-04-20T10:24:10Z [ERROR] [/controller/replication/transfer/image/transfer.go:504]: failed to push manifest of artifact rancher/mirrored-longhornio-csi-node-driver-registrar:sha256:4f59cd50e37538e0d853fc53f58d40e3ee91a56ce0706580514a7870af2cda3c: http status code: 400, body: {"errors":[{"code":"MANIFEST_BLOB_UNKNOWN","message":"blob unknown to registry","detail":"sha256:b5c97e1d373f591225559869af7f4f01399c201f89d21f903b1d23c830aa0a3f"}]}
`
**Versions:**
- harbor version: 2.7.0 (and 2.6.0)

**Additional context:**

If I run the replication rules in the opposite order, e.g. first repo_b, then repo_a, then everything works (I tested this after a fresh install of Harbor, i.e. not after first running the failing sequence described above)

**Excerpts from the logs of the failing scenario:**

_repo_a:_
```
2023-04-20T10:18:28Z [INFO] [/controller/replication/transfer/image/transfer.go:210]: copying rancher/rancher-agent:v2.5.12-debug1-windows-1809(source registry) to rancher/rancher-agent:v2.5.12-debug1-windows-1809(destination registry)...
2023-04-20T10:18:28Z [INFO] [/controller/replication/transfer/image/transfer.go:467]: pulling the manifest of artifact rancher/rancher-agent:v2.5.12-debug1-windows-1809 ...
2023-04-20T10:18:29Z [INFO] [/controller/replication/transfer/image/transfer.go:473]: the manifest of artifact rancher/rancher-agent:v2.5.12-debug1-windows-1809 pulled
2023-04-20T10:18:29Z [INFO] [/controller/replication/transfer/image/transfer.go:289]: copying the blob sha256:96303dce193a93a0a71124554c938d6f2bf81cfffd590a75d877434271dee532(the 1th running)...
2023-04-20T10:18:29Z [DEBUG] [/controller/replication/transfer/image/transfer.go:392]: the blob size is 8085 bytes
2023-04-20T10:18:29Z [INFO] [/controller/replication/transfer/image/transfer.go:291]: copy the blob sha256:96303dce193a93a0a71124554c938d6f2bf81cfffd590a75d877434271dee532 completed
2023-04-20T10:18:29Z [INFO] [/controller/replication/transfer/image/transfer.go:271]: the layer sha256:b5c97e1d373f591225559869af7f4f01399c201f89d21f903b1d23c830aa0a3f is a foreign layer, skip
:
2023-04-20T10:18:40Z [INFO] [/controller/replication/transfer/image/transfer.go:496]: pushing the manifest of artifact rancher/rancher-agent:v2.5.12-debug1-windows-1809 ...
2023-04-20T10:18:40Z [INFO] [/controller/replication/transfer/image/transfer.go:508]: the manifest of artifact rancher/rancher-agent:v2.5.12-debug1-windows-1809 pushed
2023-04-20T10:18:40Z [INFO] [/controller/replication/transfer/image/transfer.go:253]: copy rancher/rancher-agent:v2.5.12-debug1-windows-1809(source registry) to rancher/rancher-agent:v2.5.12-debug1-windows-1809(destination registry) completed

```
_repo_b:_
```

2023-04-20T10:24:07Z [INFO] [/controller/replication/transfer/image/transfer.go:473]: the manifest of artifact rancher/mirrored-longhornio-csi-node-driver-registrar:v2.5.0 pulled
:

```

issue.body:

Fixes #(issue)

issue.title: Beego session

labels.name: kind/spike
labels.description: Technical investigation work before provide concrete plan or estimation for a feature

issue.body: Because the underlying framework of Harbor's web is based on Beego, each request generates a session, which is stored in Redis. Although these sessions have expiration times, they can still accumulate significantly during high-concurrency scenarios. Additionally, some APIs might not require sessions. Further investigation is needed to determine whether it's possible to selectively enable or disable sessions for certain APIs.

issue.title: SQL Error on execution table
issue.body:
Hi,

I have this error on my logs:
```
2023-10-27T07:00:00Z [INFO] [/pkg/task/sweep_job.go:150]: [GARBAGE_COLLECTION] start to sweep, retain latest 50 executions
2023-10-27T07:00:00Z [INFO] [/pkg/task/sweep_job.go:160]: [GARBAGE_COLLECTION] listed 73 candidate executions for sweep
2023-10-27T07:00:00Z [ERROR] [/pkg/task/sweep_job.go:175]: [GARBAGE_COLLECTION] failed to batch clean candidates, error: failed to delete executions: ERROR: update or delete on table "execution" violates foreign key constraint "task_execution_id_fkey" on
2023-10-27T07:00:00Z [ERROR] [/pkg/task/sweep_job.go:110]: [GARBAGE_COLLECTION] failed to run sweep, error: failed to delete executions: ERROR: update or delete on table "execution" violates foreign key constraint "task_execution_id_fkey" on table "task"

```

**Versions:**
Please specify the versions of following systems.

- harbor version: [2.8.3]

issue.title: REST API or SDK to download the image artifact.
issue.body:
Referring to swagger https://demo.goharbor.io/devcenter-api-2.0 is there any REST api or SDK method which can download the image artifact (in .tar format) for a given project and repository in Harbor? 

We tried with Docker pull and save for this. However, we need an API or SDK method to download the image programmatically without invoking docker commands.

issue.title: REST API or SDK to download the image artifact.
issue.body:
Referring to swagger https://demo.goharbor.io/devcenter-api-2.0 is there any REST api or SDK method which can download the image artifact (in .tar format) for a given project and repository in Harbor? 

We tried with Docker pull and save for this. However, we need an API or SDK method to download the image programmatically without invoking docker commands.

comment.body:
https://demo.goharbor.io/devcenter-api-2.0 only exposes Harbor related APIs.
If you want to talk to docker registry API, there are plenty of SDKs out there. 

Search on github for project that use the [distribution spec](https://github.com/opencontainers/distribution-spec/network/dependents)


e.g. https://github.com/containers/buildah/tree/main/docs/containertools

here is an example of a few I would use as a start:
- https://github.com/google/container-explorer
- https://github.com/google/go-containerregistry/ 
- https://github.com/containers/skopeo 
- https://github.com/corpix/unregistry

issue.title: Upgrade from 2.8.4 to 2.9.0 get failed to migrate the database, error: Dirty database version 120. Fix and force version
issue.body:
I have been running upgrades, and I am trying to get from 2.3.3 to 2.9.0
- I have had some issues with this before, which is why I have been stuck with such an old version. but now I have made a duplicate copy of my live server, so that I can try and troubleshoot this... so far I have done this:
2.3.3 -> 2.4.0 ok
2.4.0 -> 2.5.0 ok
2.5.0 -> 2.6.0 ok
2.6.0->2.7.0 ok
2.7.0->2.8.0 ok
2.8.0 ->2.8.4 ok
2.8.4 -> 2.9.0 nok ok.
-
2023-10-19T11:34:31Z [DEBUG] [/pkg/config/db/manager.go:36]: create DB config manager with cache enabled
2023-10-19T11:34:31Z [INFO] [/core/main.go:163]: initializing configurations...
2023-10-19T11:34:31Z [INFO] [/lib/config/systemconfig.go:173]: key path: /etc/core/key
2023-10-19T11:34:31Z [INFO] [/lib/config/config.go:92]: init secret store
2023-10-19T11:34:31Z [INFO] [/core/main.go:165]: configurations initialization completed
2023-10-19T11:34:31Z [INFO] [/common/dao/base.go:67]: Registering database: type-PostgreSQL host-postgresql port-5432 database-registry sslmode-"disable"
2023-10-19T11:34:31Z [INFO] [/common/dao/base.go:72]: Register database completed
2023-10-19T11:34:31Z [DEBUG] [/migration/migration.go:37]: current database schema version: 120
2023-10-19T11:34:31Z [INFO] [/common/dao/pgsql.go:135]: Upgrading schema for pgsql ...
2023-10-19T11:34:31Z [ERROR] [/common/dao/pgsql.go:140]: Failed to upgrade schema, error: "Dirty database version 120. Fix and force version."
2023-10-19T11:34:31Z [INFO] [/vendor/github.com/golang-migrate/migrate/v4/migrate.go:199]: Closing source and database
2023-10-19T11:34:31Z [INFO] [/vendor/github.com/golang-migrate/migrate/v4/migrate.go:199]: Closing source and database
2023-10-19T11:34:31Z [FATAL] [/core/main.go:194]: failed to migrate the database, error: Dirty database version 120. Fix and force version.
-
Above is the tail of the log in the core container

I am aware of this issue:  https://github.com/goharbor/harbor/issues/19320
and I have tried to follow the hints there, but no help.

I have tried many things, and many times. I have in the past tried to upgrade in bigger chunks, but since that has failed, that is why I have taken such baby-steps above. 

if there are any files that you need to see to better troubleshoot, of if I can do anything to test something let me know.

comment.body:
thanks for the input, I will try that, but I have a couple questions:

1) these SQLs where do I find them?

and 

2) in the procedure for upgrading from one version to the next there is a script that is run like this: "docker run -it --rm -v /:/hostfs goharbor/prepare:[tag] migrate -i ${path to harbor.yml}" and that seems to convert the harbor.yml file from the older to the newer version... (which is fine). but. does it do anything else? or does it only convert to the later yaml format? (e.g does it do anything to the database or such... or does it only one thing, edit the yaml file?)

issue.title: Harbor and Azure Active Directory

labels.name: kind/requirement
labels.description: New feature or idea on top of harbor

issue.body:
Hi All, I would like to know if Harbor supports authentication via Azure Active Directory, is there any documentation about that integration ? 

Many thanks.

comment.body:
You can use work "app roles " in your azure app registration , link the roles to an azure ad group

As "Group Claim" use "roles"

Group Claim Name --> roles

(https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/identity/role-based-access-control/groups-concept)

forkee.name: harbor
forkee.description: An open source trusted cloud native registry project that stores, signs, and scans content.

issue.title: REST API or SDK to download the image artifact.
issue.body:
Referring to swagger https://demo.goharbor.io/devcenter-api-2.0 is there any REST api or SDK method which can download the image artifact (in .tar format) for a given project and repository in Harbor? 

We tried with Docker pull and save for this. However, we need an API or SDK method to download the image programmatically without invoking docker commands.

comment.body: You can generate the client SDK of language you needed by referring to https://github.com/swagger-api/swagger-codegen.

issue.title: Alert to blocked pulls (due to security settings)
issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

We have hundreds of images in our registry, updated as our various CI pipelines build. When a new CVE is detected, which prevents an image being pulled, a CI pipeline will break, but it can be hard and laborious to determine **which** image was subject to the new CVE.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

Identify a way to alert to blocked pulls, either with a webhook or by emitting a succint log message

**Describe the main design/architecture of your solution**

2 ideas:

1. We already have webhooks able to be triggered based on various events, but there is no event for a blocked pull. Permit the user to create a webhook to be fired on a blocked pull, and include in the payload at a minimum the artifact name.
2. Simply log the failed pull at an INFO level, and mention the artifact on the same line. This will allow for simple log parsers to alert on the event. (Currently this is only possible using DEBUG logs, and the artifact name and the failed pull are two separate log entries)

**Describe the development plan you've considered**

The addition of a log entry is probably the simplest way to achieve the desired result. 

**Additional context**
Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.

**Expected behavior:**

```bash
$ docker login https://harbor.example.com

Username: <input>
Password: <input>

# And it should just work! 
```

**Actual behavior:**

```bash
$ docker login https://harbor.example.com

Username: <input>
Password: <input>

Error response from daemon: Get "https://harbor.example.com/v2/": 
received unexpected HTTP status: 500 Internal Server Error
```

```bash
2023-10-26T22:59:52Z [ERROR] [/core/service/token/token.go:50]:
```

issue.title: OIDC Login failing with unknown internal server error
issue.body:
If you are reporting a problem, please make sure the following information are provided:

**Expected behavior and actual behavior:**
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen and what's the actual behavior. If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

Up until last Friday users could login to our Harbor.io instance without issue. Now when authenticating with OIDC they are redirected from AAD SAML auth back to Harbor with a unknown internal server error as follows:

```
{
    "errors": [
        {
            "code": "UNKNOWN",
            "message": "internal server error"
        }
    ]
}
```

Within the logs for harbor-core I can see an SQL error:

```
2023-08-30T11:43:32Z [ERROR] [/lib/http/error.go:56]: {"errors":[{"code":"UNKNOWN","message":"unknown: ERROR: cannot execute UPDATE in a read-only transaction (SQLSTATE 25006)"}]}
```

I have tried restarting the pods running harbor, but the issue persists. Any assistance would be appreciated.

**Versions:**
Please specify the versions of following systems.

- Image:          goharbor/harbor-core:v2.7.2
- Running in Microsoft AKS

Thanks.

issue.title: Harbor Admin Login Issue - Cannot Find Detailed Error
issue.body:
I'm encountering an issue with the admin login for Harbor, and I'm seeking assistance from the community to troubleshoot and resolve this problem. Here are the details:

**Problem:** When attempting to log in as the admin user (using the default credentials admin:/Harbor12345), the login is failing, and I cannot find more information in the logs other than the following messages:


```2023/10/25 18:31:49.873 [D]  init global config instance failed. If you do not use this, just ignore it.  open conf/app.conf: no such file or directory
2023-10-25T18:31:50Z [ERROR] [/pkg/audit/forward.go:44]: failed to create audit log, error dial tcp: missing address
2023-10-25T18:37:20Z [INFO] [/pkg/task/dao/execution.go:512]: refresh outdate execution status done, 2 succeed, 0 failed
2023-10-25T19:00:20Z [INFO] [/pkg/task/dao/execution.go:512]: refresh outdate execution status done, 2 succeed, 0 failed
```
**Environment:** Harbor is installed via Helm, and below are the relevant pods that are running:

```$ kf get pods
NAME                                        READY   STATUS    RESTARTS      AGE
harbor-release-core-66c8c8445d-2ngr8        1/1     Running   0             71m
harbor-release-database-0                   1/1     Running   0             73m
harbor-release-jobservice-6c4b9b4cb-g44bb   1/1     Running   0             71m
harbor-release-portal-5ddb5b8bd4-lwn56      1/1     Running   0             82m
harbor-release-redis-0                      1/1     Running   0             82m
harbor-release-registry-74bdc545b6-tkmvm    2/2     Running   1 (82m ago)   82m
harbor-release-trivy-0                      1/1     Running   7 (77m ago)   82m
```

Additional Information:

Harbor version: 2.9.0
I'm using the default admin credentials as mentioned above.
I've checked the logs but couldn't find more detailed information about the login failure.
The Harbor installation seems to be running without any issues.

I would greatly appreciate any insights or guidance on how to troubleshoot and resolve this login problem. If you need more information or logs, please let me know, and I'll provide them promptly. 

Thank you!

issue.title: Run/Install Harbor as non-root user
issue.body:
Hi all, We are using Harbor v2.5.0 in Docker Container on a Linux Virtual Machine. During some tests, we noticed that those Containers have to run as root users. If we were trying to start them as non-root users, we had the following issue: ``` [Step 4]: starting Harbor ... Traceback (most recent call last): File "bin/docker-compose", line 6, in File "compose/cli/main.py", line 71, in main File "compose/cli/main.py", line 124, in perform_command File "compose/cli/command.py", line 42, in project_from_options File "compose/cli/command.py", line 115, in get_project File "compose/config/config.py", line 402, in load File "compose/config/config.py", line 502, in load_services File "compose/config/config.py", line 481, in build_services File "compose/config/config.py", line 481, in File "compose/config/config.py", line 473, in build_service File "compose/config/config.py", line 846, in finalize_service File "compose/config/config.py", line 658, in resolve_environment File "compose/config/environment.py", line 35, in env_vars_from_file File "/code/.tox/py36/lib/python3.6/codecs.py", line 897, in open PermissionError: [Errno 13] Permission denied: '/opt/harbor/v2.5.0/common/config/registryctl/env' [21216] Failed to execute script docker-compose ``` Are there any plans to change this in the future to increase security? Thank you in advance!

Alexander Barth (alexander.barth@mercedes-benz.com) on behalf of Mercedes-Benz Tech Innovation GmbH, [Provider Information](https://github.com/mercedes-benz/daimler-foss/blob/master/PROVIDER_INFORMATION.md)

comment.body: Harbor v2.7.3, we also faced with this issue. Taking into account that running container as root user definitely isn't the best way to deploy services, that's very strange that no solution for this issue is provided. Also, running "docker-compose" command under "root" user leads to another problem - you have to manually run "docker-compose up ..." after machine reboot since most of project containers are not able to start

issue.title: Harbor `2.8.0` deleted Helm Charts, broken release pipelines, removed Chart repository functionality
issue.body:
Hi there

I wanted to leave the feedback here, that the company I work for and my personal Open Source projects have been affected by the release of minor version `2.8.0` of Harbor. The following effects have been seen:

- Helm Chart release pipeline broke
- All existing Helm Charts deleted
- All ArgoCD based Helm Chart deployments are affected
  - ArgoCD SemVer Helm Chart deployments (eg. version: `1.*`) are impossible with Helm OCI 
  - index.yaml repository index files no longer supported

The folks at the company I work for and myself did not expect that the Harbor project would not follow the [semantic versioning](https://semver.org) principles and release a minor version that would break existing functionality in our environments. This would be expected for major version changes.

Rather attending KubeCon sessions, we are now recovering the aftermath of this change.

Please be mindful about future minor/major version bumps.

Thank you

issue.title: Harbor `2.8.0` deleted Helm Charts, broken release pipelines, removed Chart repository functionality
issue.body:
Hi there

I wanted to leave the feedback here, that the company I work for and my personal Open Source projects have been affected by the release of minor version `2.8.0` of Harbor. The following effects have been seen:

- Helm Chart release pipeline broke
- All existing Helm Charts deleted
- All ArgoCD based Helm Chart deployments are affected
  - ArgoCD SemVer Helm Chart deployments (eg. version: `1.*`) are impossible with Helm OCI 
  - index.yaml repository index files no longer supported

The folks at the company I work for and myself did not expect that the Harbor project would not follow the [semantic versioning](https://semver.org) principles and release a minor version that would break existing functionality in our environments. This would be expected for major version changes.

Rather attending KubeCon sessions, we are now recovering the aftermath of this change.

Please be mindful about future minor/major version bumps.

Thank you

comment.body: This issue was closed because it has been stalled for 30 days with no activity. If this issue is still relevant, please re-open a new issue.
